Package edu.univ.scientometrics.dto

Record Class ArticleDTO

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
edu.univ.scientometrics.dto.ArticleDTO
Record Components:
id - Unique identifier
researcherId - Foreign key to researcher
researcherName - Name of the researcher (computed field)
title - Article title
authors - Comma-separated author names
publicationDate - Publication date as string
abstractText - Article abstract/summary
link - URL to full article
keywords - Comma-separated keywords
citedBy - Number of citations
snippet - Short description from Google Scholar
public record ArticleDTO(Long id, Long researcherId, String researcherName, String title, String authors, String publicationDate, String abstractText, String link, String keywords, Integer citedBy, String snippet) extends Record
Data Transfer Object for Article information. This Record provides an immutable representation of article data for transfer between application layers. Unlike ArticleEntity, this is immutable and doesn't contain JPA annotations. SOLID Principles: - Single Responsibility: Only transfers article data between layers - Open/Closed: Records are final and cannot be extended Why use DTO instead of Entity directly? 1. Decouples presentation layer from persistence layer 2. Immutability prevents accidental modifications 3. Can include computed fields not in database 4. Prevents lazy loading issues in JSON serialization
Since:
1.0
Author:
Sprint 3 Team

      public final boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. All components in this record class are compared with Objects::equals(Object,Object).
